transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: One, two, three, four, five, testing...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, do you think, uh, do you think I'd get more business or less business if as my Christmas gift I made up like 500 coffee mugs that say "Mr. Beefy"? (pause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gee, that's funny, 'cause I sent three baskets here to the Cartoon Network which everybody gobbled up and I never got "thank you" note one for...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I sent these immense gargantuan disgustingly overloaded baskets... y'know... y'know what I'm gonna do then... next year... next year...

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Let's do it. Now, I should be looking at you like this, who is this strange person, or is this kinda normal stuff?

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Okay, any other characters that may be talking?

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Oh, there's the "Tar"... what's his name?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yep, monogamy's where it's at in the 90's.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is that so funny to you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings! I'm Space Ghost. Joining me tonight, chart toppers David Byrne and Donny Osmond.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Thank you very much for having me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: David, are you having trouble with your power bands?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I just saw that you were having trouble with your power bands.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We can talk about it after the show.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Uh... Oh my gosh... (super close-up of Space Ghost's face) I... uh, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All these retro punks with their pale white skin and their black clothing... and their friggin' moist music, it... oh, I'm only kidding! I didn't say you were one... Oh, there you go, now you took offense... So, is this the first talk show you've ever been on?

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Yes it is, I hope it is not the last.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: (pause) I... Can I come back to that, I...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what have you been doing?

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Lately, I've been travelling in a bus.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Being a ghost, does that mean that, uh, that you have lived in a previous life?

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: I like that, uh, I hope the same thing happens to me?

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: I would like to live in another dimension.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We would all like to do something, David.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: D'you know what I'd like to do, David? I'd like...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (interrupts) Ah, ah, I'd, I'd like to have artho... artho...

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Yes, I would like to be cute and blonde.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) I'll take the ceramic poodle for 3000, the bumper pool table for 4200, uh, pocket calculator for 7.95, and, the rest on a gift certificate.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: I can assume a horizontal position.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: (hears heart beats; sees super close-up of Space Ghost again, looks down)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What about croutons, David? I love them on a light salad!

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Not a crouton man, but I like to put them in a separate, separate dish.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: You can have my croutons, and Bac-O's.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (voice is garbled) One, two, no, it's fine now. Hello, hello? Yep, now we're okay.

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: However, I find that in a salad they're used to inflate the size of the salad, much as if it were Styrofoam packing material.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why do you need some packing material?

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: (feeling left out) I myself am a creature from Scotland, and, uh...

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: I'm putting my insides on the outside...

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Thank you very much for having me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So this place you're going, you'll be needing a lot of "thangs".

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, a lot of things.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Like ten things or maybe twelve?

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: I believe it was Moses who brought the Ten Condiments.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Y'know, I don't think you'll be going anywhere...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (shouting) Since you're not allowed to leave!!! (pounds fist)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Oh, I think you need this destructo ray. (presses power band)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: David, I forget... what do you like on your salad again?

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: (waving hands) Oh no, I still don't have an answer!

transcript.speaker: David Byrne
transcript.dialogue: Uh... Anything that makes my skin tingle.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Croutons are what make me tingly.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Before you go, is there anything you'd like to know about me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: About me? (super close-up of Space Ghost's mouth)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: David, you're bringin' me down, man! Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're bringin' me down, man! Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (normal voice) You're bringin' me down... (Moltar throws lever)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (normal voice) Okay. You're bringin' me down, man! (laughs) All righto! My next guest... (power tools in background) (talks louder) My next guest is Donny Osmond! (intro music) Hi, Donny. Welcome to the show.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, thank you Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell us what's new with you.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: No no no no, I'm not doin' that.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Because I've seen your show before, and I've seen what you do to your guests when they start plugging, you cut to people yawning, you cut to boring things while they talk about what they're doing, so I'm not going to tell you that I'm going to release my ...

transcript.speaker: Narrator
transcript.dialogue: Behold the wooly panda. It is plump and round. The nearby sound of a throttling chainsaw frightens him. 'Eek eek' says the panda.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: ... I'm not going to fall prey to your tricks here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So Donny, is it true that... (construction noise gets louder) Ahem! So Donny, is it true that... Excuse me a second (flies off) (noise starts to die down)

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Hmm... (sings) Zorak, you're an idiot, I think you're so dumb...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: ("sings") Donny Osmond, Donny Osmond, Donny Donny Donny... feh.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I didn't know Zorak was a singer.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, listen, I'm in LA soon, so I need to sleep on your couch.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Why not? You afraid of me? Don't want me in your house?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Afraid I might kick your butt! Jerk!

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Get my agent on the phone, quick!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flies back) They're building that "Birdman" set next door.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: One thing that's buggin' me. Who's your sister?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. If Marie's a little bit country, and you're a little bit rock and roll... What's the rest of you?

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: I guess if I'm a little bit rock and roll, the rest of me is composed of mostly water.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All right. Being an Osmond, you must have many arch-enemies.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Enemies? Space Ghost, I'm Donny Osmond, I don't have enemies! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about that Bonaduce kid? I heard you two were in a big fight.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: I punched him in the nose, and I won that fight.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So you didn't win the fight.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: (louder) Set it up again, we'll have a rematch! I'll beat him!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, you won the fight, who cares?

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: How, how did you get this show? Did you, did you audition for this or something?

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: I'm kidding you, I'll be nice, I'll be kind.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, besides those teeth, what superpowers do you have?

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Um, everybody said I can sing well.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: No, no, no, grapes, they're better.

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you get Marie on the show, let her...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, why don't we get Marie on the show? Moltar, I want Marie. (pounds fist) Call her agent.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sings) "How do you solve a problem like Marie-e?" Heh heh heh...

transcript.speaker: Donny Osmond
transcript.dialogue: Just have them call my agent, talk to my attorneys, we'll set something up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm sure we can do this ourselves, Donny. This isn't our first barbecue.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Donny, Donny, Donny, hey hey hey hey hey hey hey hey, Donny!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quieter) Where do we go when we die?
